item.title: CYSTEINE

DrugCentral: cysteine
Synonymous :(2r)-2-amino-3-mercaptopropanoic acid | (2r)-2-amino-3-sulfanylpropanoic acid | (r)-2-amino-3-mercaptopropanoic acid | cisteina | cisteinum | cys | cysteine | cysteinum | free cysteine | l-2-amino-3-mercaptopropionic acid | l-cys | l-cystein | l-zystein


Drug Sentece Context


Table 1. Analysis of context sentence of cysteine gene in 5 abstracts.

pmid sentence
14617514 In common with other asbestos-induced events, this was shown to be an oxidative stress-sensitive effect, inasmuch as preincubation with N-acetyl-L-cysteine or -tocopherol (vitamin E) ameliorated the effect.
17383050 Interestingly, both taurolidine and PVP-I induced the production of reactive oxygen intermediates and decreased mitochondrial membrane permeability, and cell death was inhibited by the oxygen scavenger N-acetyl cysteine.
21364680 Apoptotic cysteine-aspartate proteases (caspases) are essential for the progression and execution of apoptosis, and detection of caspase fragmentation or activity is often used as markers of apoptosis.
22751990 Mice bearing human MPM subcutaneous flank xenografted tumors were imaged with ProSense 680, an optical imaging agent of extracellular cysteine protease activity. […] The relative contribution of extracellular cysteine proteases to the ProSense tumor signal was estimated using RT-PCR quantitation of cysteine protease RNA expression of the MPM cell lines and compared to ArrayExpress microarray RNA expression data from human MPM tumors. […] Optical imaging of extracellular cysteine protease activity is useful for tracking MPM tumor cell mass in vivo.
26889976 The significance of secreted protein acidic and rich in cysteine (SPARC) was examined in sera from a Dutch series (n=97). […] Secreted protein acidic and rich in cysteine was identified as a putative prognostic marker in plasma. […] Secreted protein acidic and rich in cysteine was present in both tumour cells and stromal fibroblasts; and our in vitro and in vivo experiments suggest that stromal fibroblasts are a potential source of circulating SPARC.
